chats.text: Hi there! I wanted to follow up on the Project Aurora specifications. Have you had a chance to review the technical requirements document I sent last week?
Yes, I've gone through the document. Overall it looks good, but I have some questions about the API integration points. Specifically around how we'll handle authentication with the legacy systems.

Good questions! We're actually working on a solution for that. The auth team suggested using JWT tokens with a fallback to API keys during the transition period. I can share the architecture diagram if you'd like.

That would be helpful. Also, I noticed the document mentions using GraphQL but doesn't specify whether we're implementing our own schema or using an existing one. Do you know which direction we're going?
We'll be extending the existing corporate schema. I'm attaching the reference docs and some sample queries that should help.
Thanks, these will be really useful. I'll review them and get back to you with any additional questions by Wednesday at the latest.
Sounds good. Just a heads up - we have a stakeholder meeting scheduled for Friday at 2pm where we'll need to present our progress. Can you prepare a 10-minute overview of your component's status?
I can do that. I'll prepare slides covering the current implementation status, remaining risks, and our timeline. Should I include screenshots of the prototype?
Yes, visuals would be great! The stakeholders always respond well to seeing actual screens. Maybe 2-3 key screens that demonstrate the main functionality?
Will do. I'll send you a draft of the presentation by Thursday morning for review.
Hey! I've just uploaded the new mockups for the dashboard redesign to Figma. Would love your feedback when you get a chance.
Just looked at them - really like the new data visualization approach! One question: are we keeping the dark mode option? I don't see it in the new designs.
Good catch! Dark mode is still planned - I just haven't created those variants yet. I'll add them to the 'Version 2' page by end of day.
Also, I noticed the new layout moves the navigation to the left side. Was this tested with users? Our analytics show most people are used to the top navigation.
We ran an A/B test last month with 500 users - the left nav actually performed 12% better for task completion. I can share the test results if you're interested.
That's surprising but good to know! No need for the full results - I trust your research. The designs look great overall.
Thanks! One last thing - would you be available for a quick sync tomorrow at 11am to go over the developer handoff process? Shouldn't take more than 30 minutes.
11am works for me. I'll bring my questions about animation implementation - we'll need to discuss performance considerations.
Hey! A bunch of us are planning to try that new Korean BBQ place downtown on Friday after work. Would you like to join?
That sounds great! What time were you thinking?
Probably around 6:30pm. We have reservations for 8 people under 'Tech Team'.
Perfect, count me in! Should I bring anything?
Just your appetite! Though if you want to bring a board game or something for after dinner, that could be fun. A few of us might go to that new barcade afterward too.
I've got Codenames - that's always a hit with the group. And the barcade sounds awesome! Haven't been there yet.
Great choice! Looking forward to it. I'll send a reminder on Friday.
Sounds good! Thanks for organizing this.
Quick update: We had to move the reservation to 7pm because of some scheduling conflicts. Hope that still works for you!
7pm is actually better for me - gives me time to wrap up that deployment. See you then!
